titles.title: Celebrating the birth of James Madison and his contributions to the Nation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.
Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 396.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/12/2000--Introduced. Recognizes the historical significance of James Madison's birth, as well as his contributions to the Nation.Urges American patriotic and civil associations, labor organizations, schools, universities, historical societies, and communities of learning and worship, together with citizens throughout the United States, to develop appropriate programs and educational activities to recognize and celebrate the life and achievements of James Madison.Calls on the people of the United States to observe James Madison's life and legacy with appropriate ceremonies and activities.
